name: Stacked Tomato and Burrata Salad
author: Chef John
summary: Comparing mozzarella and burrata is a little unfair, as burrata is significantly richer and creamier. It's not like comparing apples and oranges; it's more like apples and supermodels. In fact, burrata means 'buttered,' which is really all you need to know.
ingredients: 1  vine-ripened tomato, cored and cut into 1/2-inch slices
flaked sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup burrata cheese, or more to taste
1 tablespoon torn fresh basil leaves, or to taste
directions: Place bottom tomato slice onto a plate and season with sea salt and black pepper
Spread burrata cheese over tomato slice and top with torn basil leaves
Repeat cheese-tomato layering process with remaining slices, finishing with top tomato slice
